skill.name: docs-review
skill.description: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewing pull requests, files, or diffs containing documentation markdown files.
skill.summary: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewin...
skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, network calls, or execution patterns were found. The skill defines a documentation review workflow and formatting rules only.

content.user_title: Review docs for Metabase style compliance
content.value_statement: Documentation reviews can miss style issues that reduce clarity. This skill applies the Metabase writing guide and returns numbered fixes.
actual_capabilities: Check documentation text against the Metabase writing style guide
Flag tone and voice issues such as formal language or peppy tone
Identify unclear headings, verbose text, and buried information
Detect weak link text like here or read more here
Return feedback in a numbered issue format for tracking
limitations: Does not edit files or apply fixes automatically
Focused on documentation markdown and writing style issues
Does not validate code beyond obvious example correctness

use_cases.title: Pre publish doc review
use_cases.description: Review draft docs for tone, clarity, and link text before publishing.

use_cases.title: PR documentation check
use_cases.description: Scan a documentation diff to catch style guide violations early.

use_cases.title: Consistency audit
use_cases.description: Run consistent checks across multiple documentation updates.

prompt_templates.title: Quick doc check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this markdown for Metabase style guide issues and list numbered fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Diff focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this documentation diff for style issues and return numbered feedback.

prompt_templates.title: Tone and clarity pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this doc for tone, clarity, and link text problems. Use numbered issues.

prompt_templates.title: Structured PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these documentation files for style guide compliance and list issues in order.

output_examples.input: Review this doc update for style guide compliance
output: Issue 1: Formal tone in the introduction. Suggest replacing utilize with use.
Issue 2: Heading is vague. Suggest a heading that states the key action.
Issue 3: Link text is here. Replace with a descriptive phrase.

best_practices: Provide the exact markdown text or diff for review
Limit feedback to material issues that affect readers
Use numbered issues to track fixes
anti_patterns: Submitting non documentation files for review
Expecting automatic edits without applying changes
Ignoring line context when sharing snippets

faq.question: Which environments are supported
faq.answer: It works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for local or PR based reviews.

faq.question: What are the limits of the review
faq.answer: It focuses on writing style and clarity, not deep technical correctness.

faq.question: Can it integrate with pull requests
faq.answer: Yes, it can use a PR review tool when available in the runtime.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data
faq.answer: No, it only reviews the documentation text you provide.

faq.question: What if the feedback seems off
faq.answer: Provide more context or the full section to improve accuracy.

faq.question: How does it compare to a linter
faq.answer: It checks writing style and readability beyond automatic lint rules.
